info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 8:05PM CDT by NWS North Platte NE
info.description:
At 805 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Victoria Springs State Recreation Area to near Oconto. Movement was southeast at 35 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Broken Bow, Ansley, Merna, Mason City, Oconto, Berwyn, Weissert, Westerville, Lillian, Round Valley, Arcadia Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area, Burr Oak, Gavin Siding, Lodi, Intersection of Highway 183 and Cumro Road, Buckeye, Block Hill Basin, Pressey State Wildlife Management Area, Gates, and Cumro.
This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 73 and 109. Highway 2 between mile markers 269 and 306. Highway 92 between mile markers 273 and 307.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN CUSTER COUNTY THROUGH 845 PM CDT
